B.c.

225. Revolt of the Boian and Insubrian Gauls against Rome.

221. Assassinationof Hasdrubal ; accession of Hannibal (ii. 5).

220. Hannibal conquers the Olcades and takes Cartala (V. 3).

219. He subdues the Vaccaei, and captures Hermandica and Arbocala (v. 4). The Carpetani, joined by some fugitives of the Olcades and Vaccaei, attack him on his retreat, but are defeated and subdued (v. 5-11). The Turdetani, at variance with Saguntum, call in Hannibal. Siege and. fall of Saguntum in the eighth month (vi, vii„ viii). Debate in the Senate (vi.). An embassy sent to bid him desist (ibid). They cross to Oarthage, and, as their demands are refused, war is declared. Hannibal winters at New Carthage.

218. Advance oi? Hannibal. Foundation of colonies at Cremona and Placentia. Hannibal crosses the Pyrenees, eludes Scipio on the Rhone, crosses the Alps, and descends into Italy in October. Skirmish at the R.. 'ricinus and battle of the Trebia. Successes of Cn. Scipio in Spain. Hannibal winters in Gallia Cisalpina.
